column5: Paul you hit the nail right on the head.. I have been on this board so long... can't remember when I joined, Met & fished with a lot of great people I now call my FRIENDS. We are all family here to help out when we can. Big Cliff said it best. We laugh together, we cry together, fall down and there will be many hands to help you back up. Need anything, just ask, if we can make it happen, it will be done. Hurt just one of us and you'll think you just steped on a hornets nest!  I am proud to be a member of this community, some might think of it as a fishing board but we are so much more, fishing is just a common bond.   I my self can't think of a better site to call HONEY I'M HOME
Paul this is a amazing place and its the different people here that make it that way. the ones that don't belong come and go. The rest of us are here for like as unlike family we choose to be here.

Great thread, Paul!! I've made some darn good friends on this board, like others here, I belong to a few others as well, but, OFC is home base. I just have to stay away from the classified section  See waaaaaaaaaay too many good deals on here for fishing "stuff".

I only come here to mess with you Canadians, especially Paul as he's my favorite C.C.....  Oh, OK.....I have to admit Paul hit the nail on the head with this post...  Now where are all your favorite fishing spots.....I have come here daily since March of '07 lurking, hoping that each and everyone of you guys slip up and spill the beans only to find out today that you really can't even get the good beans (BUSH) up north....what the hell....
OH GEEZ......He's back from Vegas....

Well, I can't wait to meet most of you! Yah, even you Billy Bob! Funny place this is... I have met some great people who's generosity is frankly, overwhelming. I've stated this before, but, what the heck, I'll never be able to pay back what I get from this place... however it's my understanding that I can get shots for that! For those of you who have felt like something of an outsider... I can't suggest with more vigor... GO TO A GTG! You will meet some great people, some folks suffering from mental instability (those are the one's I apparently gravitate to) and many salt of the earth types. Once folks here know that you have just a slight mental inbalance, you will be welcomed and feel part of the group... In closing... if you can't hit it off with folks here, try plying them with beer... I've seen it work! HH
I like that part best!!!!!!!!

i'm in agreement with all that has been said. i was referred to this site a few years ago and i have never looked back.  it was far more informative than the other pages, and definitely more personal and welcoming.  we have our lively debates and dreaded winternet, but i keep coming because i do feel like i get far more from this page than fishing.  when some of you have faced hardships, i only wish is that there was more that i could do.  also, i know that if i ever faced any hardships, my comrades on OFC would always be willing to lend an ear.  cheers OFC!
I am also in greement with with what Paul said, this is a great online community and very informative forums.
HH, I am also looking forward to meeting you too someday. Beer is on me...and maybe some will even be in me...  Billy Bob...
And well rested to drive you CRAZY....
Well then Billy Bob, get your butt in gear and your mind out of neutral and book your spot up at lakair this june!!  :thumbsup_anim:
Maybe next year but this year too many things going on.
Admit it! You come back for the food porn
no need to drive...you can probably crawl the distance

Gawd i love this place Bush Beans,Long guns, rednecks,steelheaders,pet lovers,ice fishing,crappie catching,perch eating,whitefish smoking,car fixin,lure porn,boat porn,plumming,electrical,turkey watching,yote hating,bait casting,spinnin,pinning,cormorant hating,box building,carpentry advise,lure making,smart arses AND ALL!!!
ya missed drinking beer!
Nope...don't miss that a bit
it's been a while since you posted any pics of pulla or mojakka!  what gives?
Sugar counts have been a bit high lately
I didn't say YOU didn't but it DID mean it needed to be mentioned.
i know...just pullin yer crank
Don t be doing that, I'de rather the... oh never mind...
its almost a guarantee his fishing report will be "ODD" when it comes...  Good on ya Paul...wouldnt have it any other way..  Cheers mate
I'd pay good money to see that Geoff !!!!
Oh man!  Send cash to..  edit to add the pic
Now THATS what i'm talkin about Kinda looks like my cousin Willy.Just kidding TJ. A very stealthy frame indeed.

Well I've met some of my best friends here. It was really a fluke cause back then, Google didn't exist...and the search engine I had was called ummm I don't remember. What I searched for at the time was "Ontario Fisting"...misspelled it unfortunately and landed here. The QWERTY keyboard layout is really bad folks. Anyhow...it's been a while now and I enjoy speaking to everyone.
Roy, Webcrawler perhaps? lol

i was just telling a good friend of mine about this site before we left work today.i also mentioned almost every thing that mercman said.  i guess this means IM HOOKED.  OFC has been a breath of fresh air.  now if somone could help me figure out the splcheck option???  looking forward to meeting fellow members.
Believe it was called Cornucopia, Bill.
Dawg !!! you dont need spell check, your doing just fine.By the looks of it, you have that keyboard doing just what you want it to do.
I was going to say that OFC is the most fun you can have on the internet while keeping your clothes on.....but then someone had post this pic....lol

That my friends is my happy place, wood stove, prospectors tent, and a cup of morning coffee in my pjs, in a remote camp where no one can call me.  OFC has provided me with some of the highest highs ive had in my life as well as some of the lowest lows. Its been a ride, thats for sure.

I am not sure what year I joined the board but it was about 3 months before the first OFC gathering at Lakair. I missed that one but made it to several others in the following years. I am not much of a poster but I have logged in everyday since. The core group has evolved a few times over but the entertainment factor remains golden. Thanks for all the good laughs folks
I hear ya.......  Trout opener is this Friday, until then ......

Great bird shots! What was this thread about now?  This place has been AWESOME!! Met and fished with some great people. Lots of laughs and good times, some sad times too. Just a great place to pull up a chair and visit for a while. I think we should add Terry's warning label to the main page as well.  Wayne might have some competition for post numbers in a another year or so....only 10 months eh Paul?
Great Post Paul this is a great bunch of anglers here
Yah... but I can drop in out of the sky and drink your beer!!!
no ride checks up north in the air??  cheers.

LOL Salty.. in reality, my pepsi is in that blue bag on the picnic table along with our lunch. The beer can is from the firepit. If you think I'd really tip even one and then fire up my hand made creation.. not a chance.

just kidding. didnt mean to strike a nerve.  sounds like your down in my neck of the woods this weekend. if you want to get away for a couple of hours we can hit one of the rivers? your more than welcome to use my gear.   just a thought.  Don.
Three letters TJ: SAM
LOL.... anyone that wants to fly in and drink my beer is always welcome... they may not fly out.... (camp policy)
O.K. where can I land my Leer jet? Wait a minute...where can I get my pilot's licence?

We laugh together, we cry together, fall down and there will be many hands to help you back up. Need anything, just ask, if we can make it happen, it will be done. Hurt just one of us and you'll think you just steped on a hornets nest!  I am proud to be a member of this community, some might think of it as a fishing board but we are so much more, fishing is just a common bond.

I came across OFC a little over a year ago,& I must say this is 1 of the most friendly & civil forums on the net.I don't post alot but check in at least once a day. I envy the fact that several of you have the chance to get together face to face on your get togethers. I actually met Simon(limeyangler) last weekend at the local CTC store.I recognised him & Jack from some of the excellent vids he has posted.I asked Jack if he knew he was famous. I feel I know some of the members here & would be proud to call them friends.
That's cool and the bold part of the quote is damn funny!

Over the past year, i have experienced something, that i have no explaination for.Something, that when i joined, i had no idea would happen to me. Im not even sure what to call it Let me explain. When i read your posts about fishing and see your photos and video, i am excited for you almost as much as you are. When i read your requests for help about anything at all, i find myself racking my brain, and searching the net for answers and solutions to your questions. When you post jokes and humorous videos, i find myself laughing and sharing the humor with my wife and friends. And when your posts share with me the tragedies that you encounter in your daily lives, i cry. In recent weeks and months, some of you have lost friends and loved ones, and i have cried for you and have prayed for you. I have never met you, and maybe never will, but i feel the pain in your hearts, as if you were members of my own familly.Why is that? Its never happened to me before, so why now, on a fishing forum that i have only been a member of for 10 months. I feel that this forum, has made me a better man.It has stirred within me compassion, and empathy, that is completely new to me and i like it.I like it alot and those around me like what has happened to me too. And you are all responsible for the changes in me, that i carry with me into my daily living.   Paul

Thats because you are a caring guy with a big heart! With a great sense of humor, and a desire to help out other people! There is nothing wrong with a guy like that. Keep up the good work Paul! :thumbsup_anim:

actually OFC is an addiction......  I think it's more addictive then crack and harder to quit..........  maybe they should have a warning label on the main page WARNING..OFC May be addictive to certain people, which can affect your production at work and affect you ability to sleep ...also may cause you to buy large amounts of fishing tackle, boats, electronics and AS SEEN ON TV products  OFC and it's Mods take no responsibility for the actions of it's members or the jobs they aren't doing
Paul...I think it affects us all in the same way. Some to a lesser degree. I am a member on a few forums but I never seem to check them???? OFC ROCKS.
LOL.. I like that.....
well said mercman!
Yup, you got it, Paul.  We are all better because of each of us.  It really is a community.
the only problem I have is when Skeeter and I go fishing and he had chili the night before.    so never stand down wind from him...
Hahahaha, love it.    Mercman, I think it affects us all the same way.  Its a good thing and I'm glad you have changed for the better because of it

I sense a proposal in the coming months.... OFC will get the ring she alway wanted! hahah joke.  You obviously enjoy the site Paul and from my side, I enjoy your enthusiasm. It's nice to have a people who really take ownership of the things they like, to make sure they remain that way. Good on ya! Good on OFC!
Well said mon ami Paul In a nutshell... doesn't get much better than that
You haven't been around after I've served up "road kill chili"
It happens to us because, in many ways, OFC is a reflection of ourselves in the mirror.

I agree greatly with you I have changed as well, and have become addicted to this site as well. My wife can't complain though as she has her facebook and I have my OFC. I had to go out and buy a new computer today because mine crashed 2 weeks ago and I have been off work for my heart so waited until I had the money to spare. But I'm happy to be back and thank you all for the things I have learnt off here. But I better let the wife use it now seeing as this is the first site I have been on and only had the computer hooked up for 3 hours.  Chris.

Bin Wayons!!  C'est vrai en s'ti......  Paul , mon ami... You hit the nail on the head with this one.. !  I've refused requests to join other boards .. I don't care what goes on elsewhere.... I'd hazzard to guess that you're not the only one that feels this way... but probably ...the first one to admit it!  C'est beau mon homme!   Randy
No doubt about it................OFC ROCKS !!!!  But an Odd  '' Fishing ''  report here and there once in awhile would be nice
You mean aside from the bird pictures?

I've been a member here ever since I got my first computer, more than 10 years now. Although I don't post as much as some (I haven't checked, but I'm sure Paul has eclipsed my total by the hundreds in less than a 10th of the time), I'm on this site at least 2 or 3 times a day. I wish I could fish the number of hours I spend here. I haven't joined any other boards, I don't know where people would find the time.  Sandra and I will be at our first G2G at Lakair in June. I'm so looking forward to meeting a bunch of OFNrs I can't wait.
OK I just checked, 3 times my total posts...

This thread struck a nerve so I'm going to just type away.....  Other than the short hiatus I had back in 2002 Ive been here since the very birth of OFC. The day I got the call from Kevin at Lakair Lodge requesting I post a thread on a friends fishing discussion board to help get things started. It was the very first post on TJ's OFC from what I remember. Since those days I've logged on almost every day....OFC went through ups and downs like any growing family and there were times I wanted to just walk away from it all but something just kept on dragging me back... Like mercman says, we laugh together when we are happy,we cry together in times of sadness and we morn along side of families and friends when we loose the ones we love so dearly here.  Although other sites are more fishing fanatical and they ridicule our wonderful OFC for being so off topic we will always have something they do not and thats the compassion to be with and help each other in the most sincerest of ways when the going gets tuff. Each and every one of you are the very fibers that makes this site what it is today and I'm proud of what we are and what we have become and while many websites come and go we continue to stand strong as a community with deep roots holding us firm in place. OFC forever......

Thats what happens when you make your living through conversation On the phone with customers and suppliers, at my sales counter,talk all day, and i guess it overflows onto this place.Really sorry folks. I'm truly happy to know all of you, without exception, i am a richer man from the experience.  Paul

Back about year 2000 I stumbled upon a strange group of fishing fanatics on this board.  For the next couple of years I was an total inmate.  OFC was my home page and it was open 24/7.  Over time I became one of the core group, first asking, then answering all the (same old) questions...wink.  At some point I became bored and drifted away to help a friend with his new musky board.  When I wandered back, the cast of characters had changed.  Many of my old friends were gone or had become inactive.  However what was the same was that the core group were friends, even if they had never met.  They exchanged ideas, advise and stories and exchanged the events of their lives.  Since then the core has turned over several times.  What stays the same is that this is a true community.  It is also the fastest moving fishing board I have ever found.  On other boards, questions hang on the front page with little or no in-put, or worse a bunch of X2 posts.  On OFC, your post will be on page three by sundown if no one is interested...HAHAHA.  We are lucky to have OFC and lucky to be a part of this lively on-going forum.

Well said paul For me about a year and a half ago, I was typing in fishing hotspots and what ever else fishing related on the net. But then I recalled someone saying forum this, forum that. And thats what I punched in. And clicked onto OFC Im on a few others but rarely go on them at all. This is the place to be  A ton of good gents on the board, and Paul you are a generous man my friend.

I came here looking for a boat, and stayed. Made many aquaintences and more importantly friends along the way. It is truly a strange phenomenon this board, I have no idea what makes it work, but it does.
I hope it's not the pic of TJ with a drink in hand and no shirt!
